required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Father's Ability to Support Their Preschool Child
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing Father's Ability to Support Their Preschool Child

lead_sponsor.agency: Queens College, The City University of New York

collaborator.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: Queens College, The City University of New York

brief_summary.textblock: This study focuses on the development of the Fathers Supporting Success in Preschoolers (FSSP) Program, which combines evidence-based parenting interventions with Dialogic Reading to engage fathers in and improve parenting and child behavior.

primary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
primary_outcome.description: Reporting change in parenting behavior from baseline to immediately after intervention

primary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
primary_outcome.description: Reporting change in child behavior from baseline to immediately after intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
secondary_outcome.description: Reporting change in paternal depression from baseline to immediately after intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of parents cognitions regarding children behavior. reporting change in parental cognitions from baseline to immediatley after intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of child langauge skills. reporting changes in children's language from baseline to immediatley after intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post treatment (8 weeks after start of treatment )
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of early literacy skills. Reporting changes in children's literacy skills from baseline to immediately after treatment

arm_group.description: Experimental Condition. Group-based, 8 weekly sessions/2 hours per week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male Guardian
- Child enrolled in partnering Head Start site
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mental Health issues that prohibit involvement in group-based prevention study (e.g., psychosis)
